thread.title: Nationals ace Scherzer pitched no-hitter vs Mets
thread.title_full: Nationals ace Scherzer pitched no-hitter vs Mets

title: Nationals ace Scherzer pitched no-hitter vs Mets
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Nationals ace Scherzer pitched no-hitter vs Mets AP) - Washington Nationals ace Max Scherzer is pitching a no-hitter through eight innings against the New York Mets. Post to Facebook Nationals ace Scherzer pitched no-hitter vs Mets AP) - Washington Nationals ace Max Scherzer is pitching a no-hitter through eight innings against the New York Mets.  //on.wusa9.com/1LaQWRl   Join the Conversation To   Nationals ace Scherzer pitched no-hitter vs Mets Associated Press, AP 9:36 p.m. EDT October 3, 2015 during their game at Citi Field on October 3, 2015 in New York City. (Photo: Al Bello) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
NEW YORK (AP) - Washington Nationals ace Max Scherzer is pitching a no-hitter through eight innings against the New York Mets. 
Scherzer already has thrown a no-hitter this season, in June against Pittsburgh. 
The NL East champion Mets haven't come close to a hit off Scherzer. He has struck out his last seven batters and 15 overall without a walk. 
The Mets' only runner reached on a throwing error by third baseman Yunel Escobar on Kevin Plawecki's leadoff grounder in the sixth. 
Scherzer has thrown 93 pitches on a brisk, blustery night at Citi Field in the second game of a day-night doubleheader. Washington leads 2-0. 
This was the fifth time this season that Scherzer took a no-hit bid into the sixth inning. The 2013 AL Cy Young winner with Detroit is in his first year with the Nationals.
